title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate BigMed’s total revenue at the allocatively efficient quantity as $5,700 and/or does not show the work.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that the quantity demanded will decrease by more than 2% and/or does not explain that the demand is elastic in this price range because marginal revenue is positive.
The response states that the quantity demanded will decrease by more than 2% and explains that the demand is elastic in this price range because marginal revenue is positive.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that at a quantity of 10 units BigMed’s marginal product is increasing and/or does not explain that the marginal cost is falling.
The response states that at a quantity of 10 units BigMed’s marginal product is increasing and explains that the marginal cost is falling.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not identify the firm’s profit-maximizing quantity as 44 units and/or does not explain that at that quantity marginal revenue is equal to marginal cost.
The response identifies that the firm’s profit-maximizing quantity as 44 units and explains that at that quantity marginal revenue is equal to marginal cost.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

title: Part F

title: Part G
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not identify the Nash equilibrium as BigMed lowers its price and Tauem advertises with payoffs of ($420, $350) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGOaGaaeijai aabsdacaqGYaGaaeimaiaabYcacaqGGaGaaeijaiaabodacaqG1aGa aeimaiaabMcaaaa@4135@ and/or does not explain that if BigMed chooses to maintain its price, its payoff will decrease from $420 to $300, and if Tauem chooses to not advertise, its payoff will decrease from $350 to $250; therefore, there is no incentive for either firm to change its strategy.

The response identifies the Nash equilibrium as BigMed lowers its price and Tauem advertises with payoffs of ($420, $350) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGOaGaaeijai aabsdacaqGYaGaaeimaiaabYcacaqGGaGaaeijaiaabodacaqG1aGa aeimaiaabMcaaaa@4135@ and explains that if BigMed chooses to maintain its price, its payoff will decrease from $420 to $300, and if Tauem chooses to not advertise, its payoff will decrease from $350 to $250; therefore, there is no incentive for either firm to change its strategy.
